intro: Iphiona rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf iphiona, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of rounded, fleshy leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
